actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-614.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 219.
Mr. Kim moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Chafee without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 691.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development

official_title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 251 North Main Street in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, as the "Hiram H. Ward Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building and U.S. courthouse located at 251 North Main Street in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, as the Hiram H. Ward Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 251 North Main Street in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, as the "Hiram H. Ward Federal Building and United States Courthouse".
